alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 09 at 5:32PM MDT until May 15 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Eastern Uinta Basin. .Potential for rain on snow event may lead to accelerated snowmelt and a period of high runoff. Quickly rising rivers may reach critical levels by Saturday afternoon, with high water possible through Monday.
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. UTZ024-112345- /O.NEW.KGJT.FL.A.0002.230513T2017Z-230515T1800Z/ /JESU1.0.RS.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 532 PM MDT Tue May 9 2023 ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The Green River reaches bankfull which would result in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and bank erosion. At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding occurs along the Green River, including agricultural land near the river, irrigation and a few out buildings could be impacted. At 10.8 feet, The Green River reachs flood stage. Irrigation pumps and equipment near the river could be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
